title: pwd
body: Print the name of the current directory.

title: dir
body: List the contents of the current directory.

title: c:
body: Change the current directory to the root of the 'c:' hard drive.

title: a:
body: Change the current directory to the root of the 'a:' disk drive.

title: cd
body:
cd path\to\directory

Change the current directory to the one corresponding to the provided path. The path to the desired directory can be absolute or relative.
For example, if your current directory's path is 'c:' and you want to change it to 'c:\system' you can type 'cd c:\system' or just 'cd system'.

cd ..

Change the current directory to its parent directory (the one containing it) if there's one.

title: login
body:
login user password

Log as a different user, where 'user' is either 'root' or 'guest' and 'password' is the password corresponding to that account.

The default passwords for the root and guest accounts are 'root' and 'guest' respectively.

title: mail
body: Open the logged user's email reader.

title: read
body:
read path\to\file

Display the contents of the text file located in the path provided. The file's extension must be included in the path.

title: netmap
body:
Print a list of ip addresses for all the devices sharing the same network as yours. Newer versions of netmap can also print the type of device.

NOTE: netmap is only available in HEL OS version 3.0 or higher, but there are additional tools disks containing it.

title: telnet
body:
telnet ip

Establish a telnet connection to the machine with the provided ip address.

NOTE: telnet is only available in HEL OS version 2.0 or higher, but there are additional tools disks containing it.
